page.title: 11CROWN COMMISSION IN OXSHOTT
page.content: Large areas of land are still owned by the Crown Commissioners, particularly in squares 3,4,7 & 8. Here the houses are much bigger and many very 'posh': some ultra-modern, all glass or blank walls; some imitation Spanish villas, some 20th century Georgian, built of brick with pillars at the front door, sash windows and fan lights, but without the height and delicate workmanship of the 18th century; some 'mock Tudor' houses with wooden beams, weather boarding or hanging tiles. Square 7 contains Oxshott High Street and so all houses are packed closer together. The few shops were built in the 1930's, some 3 stories high and the petrol station was rebuilt in the 1970's.
